intro: Eriocaulon nakasimanum, commonly known as the Philippine spikerush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is native to the Philippines and is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes and swamps, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in spikes, and it plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native environment. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
